items.item_text: 4:30 p.m. - Call Meeting to Order at the District Board Room, 4750 San Felipe Road, San Jose, CA 95135.
items.item_text_raw: 1. 4:30 p.m. - Call Meeting to Order at the District Board Room, 4750 San Felipe Road, San Jose, CA 95135.

items.item_details:
The Board of Trustees offers an opportunity for the public to address the Board in four sections of the agenda: on matters of concern about Closed Session items; on matters not appearing on the agenda; on action items contained in the Consent Agenda; and prior to voting on any item contained in the Action Agenda. Each speaker is encouraged to submit a comment card to the Board clerk in order to be recognized to speak.
	Per Board Policy, three minutes may be allotted to each speaker with a maximum of 30 minutes per subject. No action or discussion shall be undertaken on any public comments except that members of the Board or its staff may briefly respond to or ask a question for clarification regarding statements made or questions posed by persons addressing the Board under this agenda item.
	For information and disability access to materials, call 408-270-6402. Meetings are held in a location accessible to the disabled.

b. Re-Employment
	 
Employee re-employed per the CSEA Chapter 363 CBA Article 22.2.1 "If the District reemploys a unit member as a permanent unit member under the provisions of this section, it shall disregard the break in service of the unit member and classify him/her as and restore him/her to all the rights, benefits and burdens of a permanent unit member in the class to which he/she is reinstated."

Employee separation effective 12/02/13.

items.item_details: The District employs non-bargaining unit employees in various categories to support programs and services.  These categories are: short-term assignments with limitations as defined in the CSEA/District collective bargaining agreement; substitutes to fill positions for employees on leave of absence or in vacant positions; professional experts with specialized knowledge or expertise not generally required of, or found within, the employee classifications established by the Governing Board; and athletic support staff for athletic activities.

items.item_details:
Education Code 81655 stipulates that no contract is an enforceable obligation of the District until it has been approved by the Board of Trustees. Board Policy 6100 establishes the authority of certain administrators to approve contracts under the bid limit prior to formal Board approval. All contracts and purchase orders exceeding the current bid limit of $83,400 shall have prior Board approval as a separate board item.
This consent item presents for Board approval: all purchase orders for this period, which includes purchase orders for administratively approved contracts exceeding $1,000, as well as additional contracts that, although are not executed by way of purchase order, are deemed appropriate to be added by the Purchasing Department.
items.item_recommendation: A recommendation that the Board of Trustees ratify the contracts and purchase orders for the period of October 10, 2013 through November 9, 2013 as noted in the attached documents.

ART 076B: Professional Practices and Portfolio Development 2
ECE 020:   Observation and Assessment Methods in ECE
ETH 041:    Vietnamese American Culture

items.item_details:
Title 5, Section 51010 requires that the governing board of a community college district shall:  (a) adopt a district policy which describes its equal employment opportunity program and meets the requirements of section 53002; (b) develop and adopt a district equal employment opportunity plan which meets the requirements of section 53003; (c) annually review the composition of the employee workforce in the manner required by section 53004; (d) ensure that a program of recruitment is carried out as required by section 53021; (e) ensure that screening and selection procedures are developed and used in accordance with section 53024; (f) ensure that, where necessary, additional steps are taken consistent with the requirements of section 53006; (g) ensure that the pattern of hiring and retention, when viewed over time, is consistent with the objectives established in the district's equal employment opportunity plan; and (h) substantially comply with the other provisions of subchapter 1 (commencing with section 53000) of chapter 4.
	 
Title 5, Section 53003 states that the governing board of each community college district shall submit the district-wide written equal employment opportunity plan in accordance with the requirements of Section 53003 to the Chancellor's Office. The Chancellor’s Office retains the authority to review district plans on a case-by-case basis.  Each district shall review its EEO Plan at least once every three years and revise as determined necessary.  Any revised EEO Plan shall be submitted to the Chancellor’s Office, which retains the authority to review such revisions on a case-by-case basis.  
	 
Title 5, Section 53024.1 requires each district to develop and maintain institutional commitment to diversity.  Establishing and maintaining a richly diverse workforce is an on-going process that requires continued institutionalized effort. Districts shall locally develop, and implement on a continuing basis, indicators of institutional commitment to diversity. 
	 
The San José-Evergreen Community College District’s Equal Employment Opportunity & Diversity Advisory Committee has devoted countless number of hours to the development of this EEO & Diversity Plan over the past few years.  Acknowledgement and appreciation for these special efforts go to all who have been instrumental in providing support for the development of this Plan, and in particular to the District EEO & Diversity Advisory Committee members who were appointed by their constituency groups, including:  Barbara Hanfling (Faculty Association), Clem Lundie (SJCC Academic Senate), Marjorie Clark (EVC Academic Senate – until summer 2013), Adrienne Burns (EVC CSEA), Joe Lugo, Jr. (SJCC CSEA), Vince Oen* (DO CSEA), Charles Stevens (SJCC Associated Student Government), Dr. Elaine Burns (MSC SJCC), Sam Ho (Co-Chair/MSC DO – Chancellor-appointed), Victoria Lugo* (MSC EVC), and Arturo Ocampo* (Co-Chair/MSC DO – Chancellor-appointed).  (*Those who are denoted with asterisks have left District’s employment).  The drafts of the Plan were distributed to District Council on 12.20.2012 (narrative), 4.18.2013 (attachments), 10.17.2013, and 11.21.2013.  At the 11.21.2013 meeting, District Council approved the Plan Draft.  The Plan Draft was submitted for Board of Trustees' first reading at the 11.26.2013 meeting.    
	 
The San José-Evergreen Community College District’s Equal Employment Opportunity & Diversity Advisory Committee would like to express appreciation to the Chancellor, the Chancellor’s Executive Team, the District Council representing Constituency Groups for Faculty, Classified, Management/Supervisory/Confidential, and Students for your time and efforts in the review, recommendation, and support for this EEO & Diversity Plan. 
	 
The San José-Evergreen Community College District’s Equal Employment Opportunity & Diversity Advisory Committee would like to also thank Chancellor Dr. Rita Cepeda for her leadership and guidance in the development of this Plan, and for presenting this Plan to the Board of Trustees.
	 
Attached is the final draft of the EEO & Diversity Plan, incorporating Board's recommendation at the November 26, 2013 meeting to include the narrative for adjunct faculty demographics, for Board adoption at the December 10, 2013 meeting.
items.item_recommendation: A recommendation that the Board of Trustees adopts the EEO & Diversity Plan

items.item_text: Adoption of the Measure G Bond Programs Consent Agenda
items.item_text_raw: 1. Adoption of the Measure G Bond Programs Consent Agenda

items.item_details:
On May 14, 2013 the Board agreed to enter into a contract with Swenson & Associates to provide construction services to renovate and upgrade the Central Plant and Police Station at Evergreen Valley College. 
	 
Construction contracts often times experience unforeseen conditions, coordination gaps and/or design changes that require an adjustment to the contract price and/or duration in the form of a Change Order.  The work within Change Order #004 includes changes to existing irrigation lines, new gas vent lines, boiler and chiller pad modifications, changes to metal stud work, and electrical work as detailed in the Agenda attachment.  Swenson & Associates submitted written pricing proposals for materials, equipment, labor, time extensions as applicable and the prescribed mark-ups.  The proposals have been reviewed to ensure the pricing reflects compliance with contract terms.
	 
The five items in this change order total an add to the contract of $84,958.
	 
Original Contract Amount            $9,965,000
Previous Approved Changes           $80,432
Change Order #004                          $84,958
Total Contract and Changes     $10,130,390
	 
The total net change to Swensonâs contract as a result of all Change Orders $165,390, which equates to 1.66% of the base contract.
items.item_recommendation: A recommendation that the Board of Trustees approve Change Order #004 for Swenson & Associates in the amount of $84,958 for the Evergreen Valley College Central Plant and Police Station Renovation Project.
items.item_text: Measure G-2010 Bond Program: Change Order #004 - Swenson & Associates - EVC Central Plant and Police Station
items.item_text_raw: 2. Measure G-2010 Bond Program: Change Order #004 - Swenson & Associates - EVC Central Plant and Police Station

items.item_details:
The Evergreen Valley College (EVC) Parking Lot and Street Maintenance Project provides the first phase of a northern loop road to connect the east and west EVC parking lots.  This work includes construction of a 26-foot wide road segment including associated site clearing/demo, grading, drainage, paving, signage, striping, curb and gutter and lighting.  It will also provide pavement marking including restriping and curb painting for lots 1, 1A, 2, 3, 6, 7 & 8 and select portions of Paseo de Arboles.
	 
The Board has previously approved CSW/ST2 to provide design services for the project.  On November 20, 2013 construction bids were received on that design.  The project was posted on the District’s purchasing website, advertised in local papers on October 25th, November 1st and published at 20 local builders’ exchanges and plan rooms.  In addition, invitations to bid were sent to over 120 contractors including small, minority and woman-owned firms.  Bids were received as follows: 
	 
Galeb Paving               $756,000
Granite Rock                $812,930
O.C. Jones                   $818,000
SCQ Construction        $818,818
O’Grady Paving            $1,037,957
	 
Galeb Paving, Inc. from Saratoga, CA was determined to be the lowest responsible bidder in the amount of $756,000.  It should be noted that the Galeb bid did not include two required forms related to the Construction Careers Agreement.  These forms were delivered to the District less than 24 hours after bids were received.  Upon issuance of the District’s Notice of Intent to Award to Galeb, the second-low bidder, Graniterock, submitted a letter of protest based on the missing forms.  In consultation with legal counsel it was determined that the omission was a minor irregularity, had no bearing on the material aspects of the bid (numbers and scope) and should be waived by the District.  A formal denial of the protest was issued to Graniterock.  (See attached letters.)
	 
Therefore it is recommended to award a contract to Galeb Paving, Inc. in the amount of $756,000 for the EVC Parking Lot and Street Maintenance Project.
items.item_recommendation: A recommendation that the Board of Trustees approve issuance of a construction contract to Galeb Paving, Inc. in the amount of $756,000 for the Parking Lot and Street Maintenance Project at Evergreen Valley College.
items.item_text: Measure G-2010 Bond Program: EVC Parking Lot and Street Maintenance Project Contract Award - Galeb Paving, Inc.
items.item_text_raw: 3. Measure G-2010 Bond Program: EVC Parking Lot and Street Maintenance Project Contract Award - Galeb Paving, Inc.

items.item_details:
In 2010 the District completed construction of the Evergreen Valley College Soccer Field Project as part of G2004 Bond Measure.  The project consisted of a new synthetic turf field, ADA pathway, sidewalks, stadium lights and surrounding landscaping.  The design intent included future spectator seating (bleachers) on the west side of the field.  However, the seating was not designed or installed as part of the soccer field project.  To continue the intent to add spectator seating the District (at the May 14, 2013 Board meeting) contracted with Bellinger Foster Steinmetz Landscape Architecture (BFS) to design a 2400-seat bleacher system to be constructed in two phases.  Since May, 2013 they have met with College and District Staff and Grounds personnel to develop the project design and construction documents.  The first phase consists of 900 seats and is anticipated to be completed by summer of 2014.
	 
A public bidding process for contractors was conducted between October 31, 2013 and November 26, 2013.  The project was posted on the Districtâs purchasing website, advertised in local papers on October 31st, November 2nd and published at 20 local buildersâ exchanges and plan rooms.  In addition, invitations to bid were sent to over 100 contractors including small, minority and woman-owned firms.  Base bids were received as follows:
	 
Guerra Construction Group                $660,200
Rodan Builders Inc.                            $689,000
RC Benson & Sons                            $700,000
Swenson & Associates                      $774,000
	 
Based on the evaluation of bid prices and required documentation, it has been determined that Guerra Construction Group is the apparent lowest responsible bidder.  However, the construction estimate for the project was $600,000.  For this reason it is recommended that the District accept the following two Alternate Bid prices as submitted by Guerra Construction Group:
	 
Deduct Upper Walk                           $
Deduct Street Connection                 $
	 
Therefore it is recommended to award a contract to Guerra Construction Group in the amount of $609,800 for the Evergreen Valley College Soccer Field Phase 1 Bleacher Project.
items.item_recommendation: A recommendation that the Board of Trustees approve issuance of a construction contract to Guerra Construction Group in the amount of $608,900 for the Soccer Field Phase 1 Bleacher Project at Evergreen Valley College.
items.item_text: Measure G-2004 Bond Program: EVC Soccer Field Phase 1 Bleacher Project Contract Award - Guerra Construction Group
items.item_text_raw: 4. Measure G-2004 Bond Program: EVC Soccer Field Phase 1 Bleacher Project Contract Award - Guerra Construction Group

items.item_details:
At the Board meetings held March 13, 2012 and June 12, 2012, the Board was presented information and details by the Program Management team and District legal counsel on the Lease/Leaseback project delivery method.  Subsequently, on July 9, 2013 the Board approved this method for the Automotive Technology project at Evergreen Valley College.
	 
In keeping with that process, a Request for Qualifications (RFQ) for Lease/Leaseback Construction Services, including preconstruction services was issued in October, 2013.  Six Statements of Qualifications (SOQ’s) were received on October 18, 2013.  A Selection Committee comprised of District staff and College staff and faculty scored the SOQ’s, short-listed and then interviewed three contractors.  These three contractors then submitted sealed proposals for lump sum preconstruction services fee and fee percentages for construction services.
	 
Based on the combination of points awarded and its fee proposal, C. Overaa & Company of Richmond, California was determined to be the successful firm.  Their proposal includes a fixed fee for preconstruction services (including design support, subcontract bidding and Guaranteed Maximum Price development) of $45,848 and construction service fee percentages to be applied to the Guaranteed Maximum Price.  The Guaranteed Maximum Price will be brought to the Board for approval and execution of Site & Facilities Leases per conventional Lease/Leaseback contracting.
items.item_recommendation: A recommendation that the Board of Trustees approve an Agreement with C. Overaa & Company for preconstruction services in the amount of $45,848 and construction service fee percentages to be applied to the Guaranteed Maximum Price for the Automotive Technology project at Evergreen Valley College.
items.item_text: Measure G-2010 Bond: EVC Automotive Technology Preconstruction Contract Award – C. Overaa & Company
items.item_text_raw: 5. Measure G-2010 Bond: EVC Automotive Technology Preconstruction Contract Award – C. Overaa & Company

meeting_sections.section_name: MEASURE G BOND PROGRAMS CONSENT AGENDA

items.item_details:
Ms. Miriam Carver, Consultant, will provide training to the Board of Trustees on the writing of board policies using the Carver Policy Governance Model.
	 
On Saturday, August 24, 2013, Ms. Carver provided a seminar acquainting the Board with the Carver Policy Governance® model. At this meeting, as well as at the special meetings scheduled for December 11 and December 13, she will move from the abstract model to concrete board policies. Over the next three board meetings, Ms. Carver will deal with three specific categories: Governance Process, Board-Management Delegation and Executive Limitations.
	 
Ms. Carver will act as a facilitator as the Board will do most of the work. The attached document outlines the work the Board will undertake during the next three board meetings.
items.item_text: Carver Policy Governance Model Training
